title: DBMS Level 4 â€” SQL Basics: DDL & Simple DML
intro: This level starts SQL with basic commands to create and modify tables and insert data.
points: Difference between DDL (Data Definition Language) and DML (Data Manipulation Language).
Basic DDL commands: CREATE TABLE, ALTER TABLE, DROP TABLE.
Basic DML commands: INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE.
Specify column data types like INT, VARCHAR, DATE, etc.
Add primary key and foreign key constraints in CREATE TABLE.
